result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson in court.  
Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson.  
Attorney William Ackell for  Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 


 Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson in court.  
Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an Arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Defense request an additional scheduling date to allow time to investigate. Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Defendant Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Plea withheld. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Adjustment Number: 22A 072763,
Payable Number: 1023364,
Receipt Number: 22RP030884,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Defendant Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Monterrian Jacarr Santarelli-Wilson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
